name: BreakFree Aanuka Beach Resort

reviews.text: Upon our arrival we were handed the keys and left to our own devices. We didn't know where anything was and were told absolutely nothing. The young guy and girl didn't seem to care in the slightest. Maybe this place should employ staff who actually enjoy being around people, it would make a huge difference. The place is pretty nice but the wireless is $25 for two hours - the staff couldn't even tell us how much it was, we had to investigate it ourselves. We were under the impression that the wireless it was included free with our room. Won't be staying here again... The staff suck.
reviews.title: Staff are pretty much useless

reviews.text: Hubby and I needed some time away and found this place on net. Awesome stay . Great spa in room ocean view. Lovely food . Our 2 days went so fast . We didn't want to leave . Will be back soon to inwind.
reviews.title: Very relaxing and private great food

reviews.text: We spent three nights at this property as a family group meeting from around Australia. We had both single room Bures and two storey, two bed, two bathroom units. Everyone was very comfortable and all were impressed with the setting. The lush tropical gardens were well maintained and camouflaged the many units very well.
reviews.title: Good Spot to relax
Nightmare ...
reviews.text: This establishment felt more like a resort than the golf course surrounded tower blocks of the Novotel close by.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food in the main Finz restaurant was excellent although the service was initially slow and confused. The other casual restaurant downstairs served good pizzas along with many other dishes.
reviews.title: Laid back luxury

reviews.text: I stayed here for a week .. The bed was very comfortable. The townhouse I stayed in was self catering- well equipped and clean. Excellent for a family. The shops and main centre of town are a bit of a distance so a car is definitely recommended. Restaurant menu is very expensive. So make sure you are cashed up if you intend to eat here. All in all a good stay!! Great kids pool and play area with bbq's handy. Beachfront, but you can't see the beach from your room.
reviews.title: Good - but out of town

reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights over Christmas with husband, 7 year old daughter and 2 sets of grandparents. Overall fun was had by all and considering it was a very busy time of the year, most of our requests were met (including free extra towels, and bed linen when doing room shuffles). Daughter and grandparents loved and lived in the pool and location near to beach was great. Had no problems with Cassy's bar and restaurant, food was reasonably priced, pizza's were nice and staff incredibly helpful and cheerful.
reviews.title: A nice rambling, back to nature resort that children and young at heart will enjoy

reviews.text: We were fortunate and ended up with a villa right near the parking area and close to the middle of the resort, so no issues with getting luggage and shopping between cars and rooms (but could see that for some it could be quite a drama, especially in the rain).
reviews.title: Resort was great - service & management POOR!!!

reviews.text: Cleanliness of kitchen utensils, glasses and dishes was a bit of a disappointment, had to wash all the kitchen gear before using as most of it had baked on food or grime (not very nice). This may have been due to a faulty dishwasher??. We resorted to hand washing dishes (no big deal) but were only provided with one tea towel, one washing cloth and no washing up detergent?. Another leisurely stroll to the office and this was remedied with an armful of tea towels, liquid detergent, cloths and lots of other stuff for just in case.
reviews.title: Fantastic and beautiful place to stay...just mind the lizards!
Can't wait to come back!
reviews.text: Family staying in the motel style unit found the shower recess leaked water all thru the bathroom and in the villa the shower in the ensuite (over the spa) was disappointing.

We have just gotten back from a 3 night stay at this resort. it was recommended by a local from Coffs. Having stayed at Coffs a number of times on our way up to the Gold Coast from Sydney - our expectations were low as all previous accom had been very disappointing. Finally we have found a place we can return too with confidence.
reviews.title: Suprisingly impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a 2 bed townhouse.
reviews.title: Enjoyable, clean, happy
Excellent Beach Resort
reviews.text: Cons

The carpet was old, the floor really creaky and we too spied a few cockies - which is to be expected in the middle of rainforest in a room that has big open sliding doors (but no rats thank goodness). The kitchen utensils were also a bit disappointing - only an electric frypan, no pbig suacepan for pasta, no chopping board, blunt knives. Difficult to access the restaurant with a pram - lots of stairs. People in wheelchairs will also struggle. Staff did nto really go out of their way to assist at front desk. As i was breast feeding I asked for somewhere quiet to sit as our room was not ready and was directed into a room where a function was being held....The spa is also very expensive for the quality. MAssage was good but dont bother with a facial or pedicure. No in room internet - will put in the pros as well! Dessert from room service was terrible - save yourself the calories.
reviews.title: Very disappointed. We won't be back!

reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: Ok for a holiday, not so good for business...

reviews.text: It's hard to pin down but this resort has a slightly odd feel to it. It's as if it's trying to be a south-pacific themed resort but is let down by slightly tired buildings and perhaps slightly over-grown tropical gardens.
reviews.title: Nice but a bit odd

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom and bathroom we had were a good size and the room was clean and modern. The bathroom however was in dire need of refurbishment and the plumbing was so loud I thought the vibrations were going to take the wall down.
reviews.title: Nice location, needs updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a little bit tricky to find your way around the resort. Better signage would be of great use. The pool area is quite attractive although with giant lizards all around I was slightly anxious about getting in the water, especially as the plant life was so over-grown that it too was also in the water.
reviews.title: Wow new look
Great wedding venue
reviews.text: The beach is nice but whilst we were there is was very windswept and the large waves made bathing unsafe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was a useful stop-off on our road trip but I'd not particularly want to stay for longer and if you want to eat out then you'll need a taxi or designated driver to get into Coffs Harbour.
reviews.title: Love this place

reviews.text: Having stayed at all of Coffs harbours resorts previously I thought of give Aanuka a go, Mistake. The rooms are very small and poorly designed. The bathroom was tiny and I had trouble showering.
reviews.title: Not what I was expecting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is slightly out of town which means parking is vital and there wasn't enough to cater for all of the guests.
reviews.title: Great escape

reviews.text: For the money this would be my last choice of accommodation on Coffs Harbours resort strip.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: This place is awesome. The bures are so private and very well accommodated. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. The restaurant was great for both breakfast and dinner although the resident goannas are a bit intimidating, especially when they start eyeing off your cocktails!
reviews.title: Worst experience ever
Fabulous resort
reviews.text: The beach is very close and the walks over the point have breathtaking views. The sunrise and sunsets were beautiful.

Yuck! This place is not worth it. From the unbelievably snooty woman behind reception, to the smelly room, the cold pool, the bad food, the crappy towels, the tv that looks like it was made in the 70's, the charing for wireless, and poor service, where nothing was resolved....this place is just not worth it. A classic example of what this place is like - room service: you call and order, and when it is ready, you go and pick it up from the restaurant and carry it back to your hotel room! Some room service! Thank god we are only staying one night!
reviews.title: mutton dressed up as lamb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Aanuka for one week dividing our stay between a 1 bedroom and a 2 bedroom unit. The 1 bedroom unit was great, the bathroom was modern and the atrium spa was a real treat. The bull ants however, were not. There were hoards of them in the kitchen and bathroom. Also, we rented a portacot and reception had advised that they would install it in our room, we returned to our room a few hours later and it was still not installed. When I finally went to the reception after 5 hours and spoke to one of the staff, they weren't notified of our request. Having the portacot removed was more of a challenge and took over 24 hours and conversations with 4 different staff members who kept forgetting to pass on the message. My husband ended up packing it up and returning it to reception himself. (We ended up purchasing one after the first night instead of paying the $10 per night hire fee) The big thing that I did notice was that the staff were not exceptional at Communication but great at 'forgetting' guest requests which was a big downer, especially when I rang the restaurant to order dinner and the lady offered to call our room when it was ready. My husband went down about 30 minutes later after receiving no phone call and our food was cold.
reviews.title: Great Location with beautiful Surroundings, experience spoiled by Poor service and Bullants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Speaking of food, the buffet breakfast was lovely with a nice view over diggers beach, only downfall is that the restaurant and bar are not pram friendly (not to mention wheelchair friendly for any disabled guests).
reviews.title: A cockroach ate my toothbrush !!!!

reviews.text: We had a meal at Casays bar at lunch time, the bar was empty but it still took nearly an hour for our meal to be served. Definitely don't recommend the 'Spicy Beef Nachos' as they are not as described 'spicy' and were served with some other tomato topping (tasted like tomato sauce) rather than salsa, the corn chips were overcooked and there was so guacamole. The food is expensive for what you get, especially when you pay $20.00 for a pizza that tastes worse than a McCain oven pizza, then you feel a little ripped off... oh and every pizza we ordered tasted like seafood. Best to call Dominos!
reviews.title: Great family resort

reviews.text: Casays bar looked nice but didn't have any atmosphere. Some nice music and candles on the table would change the atmosphere of an evening.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: We decided to stay here because we got it at a great price. There are good points and bad points. I'll start with the bad:
reviews.title: Fantastic - if you can get it at the right price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is absolutely huge and really spread out! Our 2 bedroom spa villa was right down the town end - quite a long walk along a maze of paths to reception and swimming pools. There is also not much privacy in the villas. Windows face onto walkways and there is an outdoor paved area with table and chairs but no courtyard wall or fence, so everyone who walks past can see you. The clothes dryer and dishwasher in our apartment sounded like trucks, and need to be replaced. Apart from right up near reception there is a road to cross and a bushy reserve between the villas and the beach. We decided to lash out on our final night and go to the fancy restaurant. The view was beautiful but the food was very disappointing for the price. The main pool near reception and the cafe seemed really dirty when we were there - my daughter ended up with an ear infection (but maybe that was just bad luck!)
reviews.title: Beautiful place, not well policed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good points:
reviews.title: Room broken into and all my valuables taken!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very comfortable spacious 2 BR villa. Great beds.
reviews.title: W.T.F?

reviews.text: Food at the cafe was delicious and good quality and although not cheap, prices weren't way over the top. And we did charge to our room.
reviews.title: Can't wait to get back there!!

reviews.text: I stayed at Aanuka in a two bedroom bungalow with my Mother and Husband in Feb 10. Overall I was pretty unimpressed with this resort. The room was a good size and clean but that is where it ended. There were a couple of problems with the room, phone not working etc and the staff made no effort to fix these during our brief stay.
reviews.title: Not a 4.5 Star resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went for a drink in the bar and as it had just finished raining outside all of the seats were wet. We asked if we could get something to dry them with and were thrown a towel from the other side of the bar. After our relaxing drink we went upstairs to the restaurant to get a table for dinner. We were told that there would be a one hour wait for food as they had just seated a wedding party of 27 people and had to serve them first. I tried to explain that we had attended a funeral earlier in the day and just wanted to have a quiet meal and then go to bed and so is there anyway we could get room service. I was abruptly told that they don't do room service. So we wandered down to reception, explained the situation and asked them to recomend somewhere nice for us to go to dinner. They recommended an RSL club which was not at all what we had in mind. We checked out before breakfast the next day as we had an early flight. Would I stay there again? Unlikely.
reviews.title: Very Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of March.The setting is fantastic being on the beach with magnificent views and wonderful long walks.We found the resort food to be of good quality and Happy Hour most enjoyable.The weather was not the best(but this is hardly the resort's fault !) and we did have one minor issue with regard to our bathroom,however we can truly state that during our stay we did not come upon one member of staff who was anything less than courteous,helpful and genuinely pleasant.Good customer service makes for a very relaxing time.
reviews.title: Looks Good - Feels Bad

reviews.text: The bad news starts at reception. The staff are rude, slow and clearly intent on ripping off the punters. The rooms are OK, about 3 star standard, but the service is atrocious. Cleaning does not exist at Aanuka Beach.
reviews.title: Lovely resort but beware of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant has stunning views, high prices very average food, terrible service. The bar closes at 7.30, if you want a drink you have to go to the restaurant and try to get a waiter to get you a drink which can take 40 minutes.
reviews.title: Lovely - but some work needed on their customer service

reviews.text: Upon arriving I spoke to my 10 year old son about the kids club for children aged 2-12 year olds. The staff member at reception interrupted me and said that he wouldn't like it, as it was for younger children around 4-5. I brought to his attention that it stated on the kids club roster there that it was 2-12. No he wouldn't like that it is for 4-5 year olds.
reviews.title: Filthy, mould ridden apartments

reviews.text: We stayed close to the kids club and in the week we were there it was always closed and empty. I wondered if it even existed except on a piece of paper and and an empty room full of kids stuff.
reviews.title: relaxing and peaceful

reviews.text: Upon opening the door to our apartment I noticed the leaves and dirt on the floor, apartment obviously not cleaned. Finger marks on the TV, walls and doors. Dried milk and food on the table and coffee table. The paint on the stairwell was chipped and the stair carpet was badly stained. There was a long black hair on the toilet bowl in the ensuite bedroom and spiders in the spa bath, with mould in the grout. I called reception who sent the manager for cleaning around to the apartment to clean it. She arrived promptly and wasn't that interested in what I had to say. She asked if we would like another apartment and I said no I would just like this one cleaned.
reviews.title: Nice location but terrible restaurant service

reviews.text: We left her to get supplies from town. Only to arrive and find the door ajar with no cleaner in sight. Apartment smelt nice but not very different although the floor had been swept. Later that night I had a shower in the main bathroom. The shower had soap scum on the floor tiles and on the shower screen. There was black mould in the grouting and all around the shower doors. As the days progressed a mound of dirt appeared on the bathtub which grew daily. This was due to the massive ant problem we had in the apartment. The bedrooms always smell musty in the mornings and it became apparent that this would most like be due to the massive black mould problem in the stair well, which bowled you over every time you opened the door. In the laundry when I moved the laundry basket, it became apparent the the laundry basket most likely hadn't been moved for maybe several years as the dirt, sand and fluff from the drier was thick enough to make a dooner for the master bedroom.
reviews.title: A Must Read before Booking!

reviews.text: We stayed for one night in a hotel room. The resort has great potential but just needs a little updating. Our room was obviously dated and had a mouldy bathroom. The doona had no cover on it and there were a few spiders in the room. However, the beach out the front is lovely and there are some great areas to entertain small children in the resort grounds. The restaurant is FANTASTIC, our meals were great and the service was superb so this made up for the other disappointing factors.
reviews.title: Great Restaurant makes up for disappointing resort

reviews.text: We stayed here with our 3 month old daughter and my parents in march this year for two nights. Our daughter was able to stay for free and we all shared a 2bdr villa. It was 2 storey with the bedrooms upstairs. 2 full bathrooms upstairs and a 3rd toilet downstairs. Full laundry.
reviews.title: Quiet, fun with great surf beach

reviews.text: The resort itself is like something in fiji. Meandering paths, palm trees very peaceful. The pools are great. My fiance and my father both had a great time with the waterslide. Not just for kids.
reviews.title: Magnificent family vacation !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach out the front is lovely. It is a surf beach with quite decent waves most of the time.
reviews.title: Pretty average

reviews.text: We would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: A Beautiful place and relaxing holiday
Highly recommend
reviews.text: Great location on a lovely beach, 3 excellent pools which my children had a good time in, a great restaurant with very good food and service (pricey), very nice accommodation too, although starting to be a little dated and good service all round.....next time I'm in Coffs Harbour - I'm coming back here

We stayed for 6 nights 3 weeks ago and found the resort and room very relaxing. We enjoyed swimming and relaxing by the different pools and outdoor spas during our stay. We had a nice clean and tidy 2 bedroom self contained unit with a spa bath situated near the car park which was convenient for us. The room we stayed in was near the road but any traffic noise was hardly noticed. We had a comfortable bed to sleep in and our 9 year old son also slept well in his bed each night. The resort is right on the lovely diggers beach which also added to our relaxing stay. The staff were helpfull and friendly. We enjoyed the various wildlife the resort and look forward to coming back next year.
reviews.title: Very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were staying here as a one night stop over on our trip up the east coast. We checked in and were told our room location and given a bunch of keys (not told what any of them were for). I turns out one was for the gate to get into our section of the complex, one for the door and one for a safe that I only saw the next day.
reviews.title: ok.. depends what are there for
Wonderful spot and private Bures.
reviews.text: The resort itself could do with a bit of a face lift. I think whoever planted all the palm trees went a bit overboard as the end result is a lot of the chalets/rooms are very dark.

However it did seem like a good place if you wanted to bring the kids or family for a few days and have your own beer/food (you had your own fridge and there were bbq facilities) . It just wasn't for us on this occasion.
reviews.title: Stayed longer

reviews.text: My friend and i stayed here on our way to Brisbane and we were both pretty happy. we checked in late and the guy at the counter was very friendly - made us feel very welcome. Our room was pretty good - we had requested 2 singles and the room had a king, but that did not matter. however if you really needed 2 singles i would probably ring ahead and check that it definately did. bed was comfy and huge!
reviews.title: Will come back again"

reviews.text: i noticed some people on here complaining about the walk from the room to the restaraunt - well first of all its only a leisurly 5 minute stroll - i think some people are a little lazy!!! and the "little critters" running about - its set in a rainforest type environment what do you expect. a few birds and a turkey looking thing not scary nad the children would enjoy looking at them anyway.
reviews.title: Hard to see how this resort is classified as a 4.5 star, watch out for the little critters.
Perfect for families
reviews.text: breakfast was beautiful - nice variety and the deck overlooking the beach and grounds is really nice.
the only negatives from the trip were (and they are minor) -
reviews.title: Resort has potential just needs a little TLC

reviews.text: 1) the pipes in the shower were incredibly loud it took quitee a while to adjust the water flow till there was no noise coming from them. mite be a bit annoying for other visitors close by, especially late at nite or early morning.
reviews.title: Really nice resort, shame about the staff at the check in counter!

aka: Breakfree Aanuka Beach Hotel Coffs Harbour
